name: 2-pyridineacetamide
Reason: 2-Pyridineacetamide has a basic unit of pyridine, which has a melting point of -41.6°C. The introduction of the acetamide group increases the molecular weight and introduces hydrogen bonding potential, which can increase the melting point. The acetamide group can participate in hydrogen bonding with the pyridine nitrogen atom, which can increase the melting point due to the additional hydrogen bonding. The acetamide group can also participate in hydrogen bonding with itself, which can further increase the melting point. The net effect of these structural modifications is a significant increase in the melting point.
